questions.question_text: What is a purpose of a customer stakeholder map?

choices.D: to identify the critical elements of customer culture

discussion.content: A. to create a communication plan

Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A. to create a communication plan.

Selected Answer: C
Correct: C
Operational involves the knowledge and skill level of a hands-on manager of your solution, and the users ability to use the solution.

questions.question_text: What is the barrier type when end-users are having difficulties understanding the features and functionalities of the new solution?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A is not correct D seems more logical correct

questions.question_text: A customer is concerned that a lot of data is presented during quarterly business reviews, but not many insights. Which action resolves this issue?

choices.D: Agree on a set of metrics and share the results and trend lines with recommendations for improvement.
choices.C: Explain the limitations of the available reports and offer options to provide input to develop new reports.
choices.A: Provide the customer with access to the raw data to enable them to develop their own insights.
choices.B: Appoint a customer representative to review the data and give specific suggestions.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
No I'd agree that D seems the most logical answer. By looking at the people, processes and tools you can identify a number of barriers - are the staff open to change? Do they have the technical knowledge to use the new solution? Have they been trained sufficiently? Are there processes in place to resolve issues arising from the new solution, or to resolve concerns users may have? Do the users have the tools required to be able to use the new solution correctly? All of that makes sense.

Selected Answer: A
After searching and studying it seems that A is the correct answer (not sure)

questions.question_text: What are the sources used to identify barriers?

choices.D: Implement staff Super Users to provide feedback
choices.B: Measure the number of complaints raised by students
choices.C: Combination of tailored surveys and IT tools-based metrics
choices.A: Twice yearly student and staff surveys with two questions related to IT

discussion.content: C. Combination of tailored surveys and IT tools-based metrics
The answer should be C (Students + Staff) combined surveys and IT tools-based metric should be great data to measure the success with customer.

Selected Answer: B
cause I say so.

Selected Answer: C
It is C.

Selected Answer: C
C - Combination of tailored surveys and IT tools-based metrics. Staff missing in B.
students and staff = C as the only option?
None of these answers seem ideal but hard to see how B could be classed as THE right answer when it only talks about looking at student complaints rather than the staff as well
You would need to measure complaints by both student and staff, not just the complaints by the students. I think C is a better answer.

questions.question_text: A large university has deployed a new IT solution designed to improve the overall student and staff experience. Which approach to measure success is the best?
